sentences.english: You will surprise everyone with your no nonsense approach to life and everything you do.
sentences.chinese: 你對生活和工作雷厲風行的態度讓每個人都感到驚奇。

sentences.english: The result of this flurry of activity was a significant simplification of the specification.
sentences.chinese: 這次雷厲風行的行動使這個規範顯著簡化。

sentences.english: They worked vigorously and speedily and planted three thousand young trees in two days.
sentences.chinese: 大家說幹就幹，雷厲風行，兩天就栽種了三千棵樹苗。

sentences.english: Because vigorous and resolute, gives the impression is generally very hard.
sentences.chinese: 因爲雷厲風行，給人的印象一般是很硬。

sentences.english: It takes time to develop the habit of taking action.
sentences.chinese: 要養成雷厲風行的習慣是需要一點時間的。

sentences.english: The two daughter right Wei is a television presenter, work resolutely.

definition: able and efficient
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
meticulous/thorough/comprehensive/complete/detailed
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to prevail upon/to coax
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
retort with challenging questions/debate
firm/unwavering
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
readily following good advice (idiom); willing to accept other people's views
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
(to act) on one's own initiative
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
